quote: I often use it in place of Google to learn about various topics, anything from growing a vegetable garden to places to travel for our next holiday.
I use it for top sites to see, helping me decide between different activities based on the needs of multiple people in the family group. It also helps me as a budget calculator.
I'm looking to find out about the best placement, what kind of soil I need to have, and how I can kick off the project with the most success possible.

I wanted to use it to help mock up the area that I had planned by just putting in points and hoping that it would draw a good diagram for me. However, it ended up being quite a lot of effort, and while it was close, it wasn't ideal.
The dimensions just weren't close enough. It was doing some funny things because our lawn isn't a straightforward shape.

the most amazing AI personal assistant would be in my inbox helping me to filter information. It would distinguish between what I really need to know and what is nice to know, identifying jobs to be done, key dates, and anything related to financials all in one place, including the last possible date I need to pay something.
There are just too many emails and too much information around kids' sports and school newsletters as well, so it would be great to pull out what's really useful for me.

I want to track what payments are coming out and what has been received from all of those automated emails. Over time, it would be helpful to share data about my finances, showing where the spikes are in terms of what I'm paying and for what, and serving that information back to me.
it's really about scheduling around what is coming up. This might look like having a month view, fortnight view, week view, and day view, to be as organized as possible.

having a supermarket list that automatically integrates with your local supermarket and what you need to buy. Then you could choose to press a button and ask the supermarket to have it ready for pickup at a specific time.
It would enable my partner and me to be on the same page and help our children become more independent as they get older, as well as manage what's happening for them.

I felt okay about being interviewed by a person that's not a human, but I also know who the study is being run by, which probably isn't a true reflection of how I would feel if I were receiving this from nobody. Even if it's coming from AI, I know that there is always a person behind the study.
Perhaps a small video introduction from that person first or some kind of human interaction would be good.
Just something brief introducing the study and a little bit about that person. Yeah, do something to humanize it up front. It can be, you know, fifteen seconds long even.
